citation.case_name: United States v. Huck Mfg. Co.

html:
382 U.S. 197

86 S.Ct. 385

15 L.Ed.2d 268

UNITED STATES, appellant,
v.
HUCK MANUFACTURING CO. et al.

No. 8.

Supreme Court of the United States

Oct. Term, 1965.

December 6, 1965

Donald F. Turner, Asst. U. S. Atty. Gen., for appellant.

Dennis G. Lyons, Washington, D. C., and Thomas W. Pomeroy, Jr., Pittsburgh, Pa., for appellees.

Assistant Attorney General Turner (Acting Solicitor General Spritzer, Frank Goodman and Robert B. Hummel, on the brief), for the United States.

Dennis G. Lyons and Thomas W. Pomeroy, Jr. (Paul A. Porter, William L. McGovern, John A. Blair, S. K. McCune and W. Walter Braham, Jr., on the brief), for appellees.

PER CURIAM.

1

Judgment affirmed by an equally divided Court.

2

Mr. Justice FORTAS took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
html_lawbox:
382 U.S. 197 (1965)

UNITED STATES
v.
HUCK MANUFACTURING CO. ET AL.

No. 8.

Supreme Court of United States.

Argued November 15, 1965.
Decided December 6, 1965.
APPEAL FROM THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT OF MICHIGAN.

Assistant Attorney General Turner argued the cause for the United States. With him on the brief were Acting Solicitor General Spritzer, Frank Goodman and Robert B. Hummel.

Dennis G. Lyons and Thomas W. Pomeroy, Jr., argued the cause for appellees. With them on the brief were Paul A. Porter, William L. McGovern, John A. Blair, S. K. McCune and W. Walter Braham, Jr.

PER CURIAM.

Judgment affirmed by an equally divided Court.

MR. JUSTICE FORTAS took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
